name: Khachapuri
short_description: Originating from Georgia, khachapuri is a beloved cheese-filled bread, topped with gooey Sulguni cheese, a rich egg, and a pat of butter. Its warm, savory flavors embody the heart of Georgian hospitality.

name: Khinkali
short_description: Savory Georgian khinkali dumplings burst with a flavorful mix of ground beef and pork, seasoned with fragrant blue fenugreek. Their twisted tops hold a deliciously rich broth, making each bite a delight.

name: Lobio
short_description: A cherished Georgian stew, Lobio features tender red kidney beans simmered with aromatic spices like coriander and garlic, creating a hearty and flavorful dish that embodies the warmth of traditional cuisine.

name: Mtsvadi
short_description: Skewered and grilled to perfection, this Georgian delight features marinated mutton, veal, or pork infused with tangy lemon and pomegranate juices, offering a burst of rich, smoky flavors. A staple at feasts, Mtsvadi embodies the warmth of Georgian hospitality.

name: Imeruli khachapuri
short_description: Originating from the Imereti region of Georgia, this circular pastry delights with its rich, gooey filling of Imeruli and Sulguni cheeses, all enveloped in a soft, golden crust. Perfectly baked, it’s a savory indulgence that captures the heart of Georgian cuisine.

name: Kharcho
short_description: Rich and aromatic, this Georgian meat soup combines tender beef or chicken with rice, onions, and tomatoes, all perfectly seasoned with the unique khmeli suneli spice blend for a comforting, flavorful experience.

name: Chicken tabaka (Tsitsila tabaka)
short_description: Originating from Georgia, chicken tabaka features a whole chicken flattened and pan-fried to crispy perfection. Infused with garlic, hot peppers, and coriander, it delivers a flavorful punch in every bite.

name: Kupati
short_description: Spicy and aromatic, Kupati showcases the rich culinary heritage of Georgia with its blend of ground pork and beef, infused with garlic, onions, and warm spices. Grilled to perfection, it promises a savory bite that embodies the essence of the Caucasus.

name: Ajaruli khachapuri
short_description: Originating from the Black Sea region of Georgia, this open-faced pie boasts a rich, cheesy filling of Imeruli and Sulguni, topped with a perfectly cracked egg. Baked in yeasted dough, it’s a warm, gooey delight that captures the heart of Georgian cuisine.

name: Ghomi
short_description: Originating from Georgia, Ghomi delights with its creamy blend of coarse and fine cornmeal, creating a comforting porridge. Topped with melting sulguni cheese, it offers a rich, savory experience.

name: Ajika
short_description: Originating from Georgia, Ajika delights with its fiery blend of hot peppers, garlic, and earthy walnuts. This vibrant dip bursts with fresh herbs, adding a zesty kick to any meal.

name: Lobiani
short_description: Traditionally enjoyed during the feast of St. Barbara, this hearty Georgian bread features a savory filling of mashed kidney beans, onions, and fresh herbs, baked to golden perfection.

name: Sulguni
short_description: Originating from the Samegrelo region of Georgia, Sulguni boasts a mild yet complex flavor and a semi-firm texture. Enjoy it fresh or melted, making it a delightful addition to any meal.

name: Tenili
short_description: Creamy and tangy, this Georgian cheese from the Samtskhe-Javakheti and Kvemo Kartli regions is crafted from rich cow's or sheep's milk, delivering a delightful burst of savory flavor. Perfect for pairing with fresh bread or enjoying on its own!

name: Gozinaki
short_description: Originating from Georgia, Gozinaki features crunchy walnuts caramelized in rich honey, creating a delightful balance of sweetness and nuttiness. These golden, crisp bites are a festive favorite!

name: Khmeli suneli
short_description: A staple in Georgian cuisine, Khmeli suneli enchants with its warm mix of blue fenugreek, coriander, and dill. This aromatic blend elevates stews and meats, infusing dishes with a vibrant, earthy flavor.

name: Shebolili Megruli Sulguni
short_description: Originating from Samegrelo, smoked Sulguni enchants with its rich, tangy flavor and creamy texture. Crafted from a blend of cow and buffalo milk, it’s a beloved staple in Georgian cuisine.

name: Matsoni
short_description: A cherished staple in Georgian cuisine, Matsoni is a creamy, tangy yogurt made from boiled cow’s milk and a traditional starter culture. Its smooth texture and refreshing flavor make it perfect for pairing with savory dishes or enjoying on its own.

name: Imeruli
short_description: Originating from the Imereti region of Georgia, this fresh curd cheese boasts a creamy texture and mild flavor. Perfect for enhancing dishes or enjoyed on its own, it's a beloved staple in Georgian cuisine.

name: Jonjoli
short_description: A unique Georgian appetizer, jonjoli features pickled sprouts from local bushes, harmoniously blended with olive oil and vibrant pickled vegetables. Its tangy and earthy flavors bring a taste of tradition to your palate.

name: Blue fenugreek (Utskho suneli)
short_description: Native to Georgia's mountains, blue fenugreek, or Utskho suneli, adds a rich, earthy flavor to traditional dishes. Its aromatic leaves and seeds elevate stews and sauces, embodying the essence of Georgian cuisine.

name: Narchvi
short_description: Originating from Georgia's Svaneti region, Narchvi is a rich, aged cheese made from cow's milk, pressed in wooden towers for over three months. Its unique texture and robust flavor make it a culinary treasure.

name: Dambalkhacho
short_description: Originating from the Mtskheta-Mtianeti region of Georgia, this dry moldy cheese bursts with a tangy, savory flavor. Made from buttermilk cottage cheese, it’s salted and shaped, offering a unique taste of tradition.

name: Bladdernut sprouts (Jonjoli)
short_description: Young and tender, these Caucasian sprouts burst with a unique, slightly nutty flavor. Traditionally foraged in Georgia's spring, they shine when lightly sautéed or pickled, adding a vibrant touch to any dish.

name: Saperavi
short_description: Originating from Georgia's Kakheti region, Saperavi delights with its deep, rich flavors of dark berries and subtle earthiness. This resilient red wine showcases the region's winemaking heritage beautifully.

name: Rkatsiteli
short_description: Originating from Georgia, Rkatsiteli offers a rich tapestry of flavors, from crisp green apple to honeyed stone fruit. Its versatility shines in dry, sparkling wines and traditional brandies, celebrating centuries of winemaking heritage.

name: Georgian amphora wine
short_description: Crafted using an ancient Georgian method, this wine ferments in traditional terracotta amphorae, blending grape skins and juice for a rich, complex flavor profile. Enjoy its bold tannins and earthy notes.

name: Chinuri
short_description: Originating from Georgia's Kartli region, Chinuri captivates with its vibrant acidity and crisp notes. Perfect for refreshing white wines, it embodies the country’s rich viticultural heritage.

name: Chacha
short_description: Crafted from the remnants of grape pressing, Georgian chacha delivers a robust, fruity punch with earthy undertones. Celebrated as a national spirit, it embodies the rich winemaking heritage of Georgia.

name: Tsinandali
short_description: Originating from Georgia's picturesque Kakheti region, Tsinandali enchants with its crisp blend of Rkatsiteli and Mtsvane grapes. Expect refreshing notes of green apple and citrus, perfectly embodying local winemaking traditions.

name: Tsolikouri
short_description: Originating from western Georgia, Tsolikouri enchants with its crisp acidity and floral notes. Enjoy it as a refreshing dry white or a luscious semi-sweet dessert wine, capturing the region's rich winemaking tradition.

name: Mtsvane Kakhuri
short_description: Aromatic and vibrant, Mtsvane Kakhuri hails from Georgia's Kakheti region, producing delightful white wines with lively citrus and floral notes. Its unique tannic structure elevates every sip, making it a true cultural gem.

name: Tavkveri
short_description: Native to Georgia, Tavkveri grapes yield vibrant red and rosé wines with juicy berry notes and a refreshing finish. Perfectly captures the essence of Kakheti’s sun-soaked vineyards.

name: Shavkapito
short_description: Native to Georgia's Kartli region, Shavkapito grapes produce rich, full-bodied red wines with notes of dark berries and subtle spice. Rarely cultivated, they embody the country's winemaking heritage and promise exciting flavors.

name: Kisi
short_description: Originating from Georgia's Kakheti region, Kisi delights with its rich, complex flavors of honey and stone fruit. Often crafted into distinctive amber wines, it embodies centuries of winemaking tradition.

name: Usakhelauri
short_description: Enchants with its luscious semi-sweet profile, showcasing rich red berry flavors and a hint of spice. Grown in Georgia’s historic Lechkhumi region, it embodies the essence of local tradition.
